content.description: Very good route on solid rock. Between the second and third bolt is definitely the crux. The route is very balancy and slabby but fun. A little foot scumming goes a long way. This route can be a little mind boggling, think fast or suffer the pump.
content.location:
This route is just to the right of

Ghost of Cedar Creek

.

climbs.name: Ghost of Cedar Creek
climbs.fa: D. Peavey, K. Gibson, T. Wilhelmi '03

content.description: Excellent edges on a vertical, white face. There's some rotten rock in the dark area to the right that still needs to be cleaned, but the majority of the route is very good.
content.location: On the southeast side of the creek on the way up to the bat cave. The leftmost of 3 routes on this face.

content.description:
Spanish for 'ladder'.  This fun route has something for everyone from underclings to handjams.  Move up and right into the dihedral/chimney and use everything you can find.

The cruxy section comes at the 4th bolt.  As a new leader, I felt it was harder than 5.8 through there.  The anchors are on the face to the right around the corner from the last bolt, kind of hard to see where to go from that spot.
content.location:
It is on the second tier of Vatoville, above most of the other climbs.

Per

Michael Windsor

: from the Citadel, you can reach this route by hiking west (left if you're looking at Rapunzel, Rapunzel) down the back side of the hill toward the creek. You'll be at the route within 50 yards.

content.description: Another route that is just under vertical. Small holds are the name of the game. The route is fairly consistent the whole way, but the hardest part comes during the first two bolts. Decking my be an issue. This is definitely a thinking route, power will do you little good.
content.location:
This route is second from the right of

Ghost of Cedar Creek

.
